title: Reward offered for arrest, conviction of shooter in Conway home invasion
content:
CONWAY, SC (WBTW) – A reward of up to $5,000 is now offered for information leading to an arrest and conviction of the person who ran into a Conway home and shot four people in late November.
According to Lt. Raul Denis with Horry County Police, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, and the Horry County Police Department are now offering the reward so officers can get a dangerous suspect off the streets.
Horry County Police Sgt. Greg Hutchins says officers responded to a shooting at a home on Colletta Court around 11:40 p.m. the night of November 24. A black male is accused of unlawfully entering the home and shooting four victims, all of whom were treated at a local hospital for gunshot wounds, police add.
Captain Dale Buchanan confirms two men and two women were sitting inside the home when the unidentified black man fired multiple shots through the front door. All four people were struck by the bullets, Buchanon said.
Anyone with information about this crime should contact ATF at 1-800-ATF-GUNS (800-283-4867) or the HCPD Tip Line (843) 915-8477. All calls will be kept confidential.
